input_text:
Job Title: Lead Transportation Material Expediter

Location: Palmdale, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides four specific areas of expertise—Logistics Engineering, Measurement Sciences, Program Management, and Technical Support—serving the scientific, technical, and engineering needs of clients. GbILS values its innovative thinking and service-oriented team who provide services for a variety of federal government and commercial clients.

Summary:

The Lead Transportation Material Expediter will provide services and support to the NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center contract located at Palmdale , California. The Lead Transportation Material Expediter will perform duties primarily associated with SCA Labor Category Material Expediter from the SCA Directory of Occupations 5th edition.

Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

 Be assigned to one or more work areas to support contract Logistics Services consisting of: Supply and Materials Management  Equipment Management  Property Disposal  Transportation Management (including shipping and fleet management)  Mail Management  Lead shipping and receiving duties to include warehouse support  Support multiple aircraft programs at both 703 and main NASA AFRC  Perform duties found within the Performance Work Statement (PWS) Section 7, Transportation Management Operations, especially section 7.15 Freight, to support PWS Section 4, Supply and Materials Management and Section 5, Equipment Management in accordance with NASA Instructions and Technical Directives  Leadership over entire section to include metrics and reporting, prioritization, training, scheduling, etc.  Provide transportation services IAW 49 CFR, NPD 6000.1, Transportation Management, NPR 6000.1, Requirements for Packaging, Handling, and Transportation for Aeronautical and Space Systems, Equipment and Associated Components, NPR 6200.1, NASA Transportation and General Traffic Management, “NASA Fleet Management Handbook”  Utilize NASA provided computer equipment and software/databases to perform required job duties  Be familiar with NASA publications, forms, and regulations listed in the PWS and how all work activities are performed in accordance with those references Develop, track, maintain, and present data and metrics  Gather and communicate data and metrics for weekly and monthly reporting as well as fulfilling ad hoc requests  Prioritize work and developing daily, weekly, and monthly schedules Tracking progress towards completion of schedules  Ensure employees are trained in all aspects of their work requirements to include applicable NASA and other federal regulations and systems  Escalate personnel issues to supervisors  Develop and keep up to date Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)  Locates and moves materials and parts between work areas to expedite processes according to pre-determined schedules and priorities  Maintain records, inventory reports, and work orders to determine types, quantities, and availability of required material according to NASA priorities  May be tasked, trained, and perform duties as a non-CDL Truck Driver or Material Handling Equipment operator, including operating: Medium Trucks, Forklifts, and Specialty Material Handling Equipment 

Qualifications

Necessary Skills and Knowledge:

 Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs.  Must be able to pass NASA forklift training and certification and pass NASA physical to receive forklift license.  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and via email  Ability to perform the physical requirements of the position including being on your feet most of the day and lifting requirements.  Ability to be trained in the use of warehouse tools and manual material handling equipment. 

Minimum Qualifications:

 Ability to obtain and retain a Common Access Card (CAC).  Must be able to clearly read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.  Ability to pass a background check including a clean driving record.  Pass pre-employment drug screening. 

Preferred Qualifications:

 Previous experience in using computers as part of a military or civilian retail / store / warehouse environment.  Previous experience working in a warehouse or other industrial environment and/or experience with driving trucks and/or other non-CDL required vehicles.  High school diploma or equivalent 

The salary for this position is $36.71 per hour.

Pay And Benefits

At Goldbelt, we value and reward our team's dedication and hard work. We provide a competitive base salary commensurate with your qualifications and experience. As an employee, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company matching, tax-deferred savings options, supplementary benefits, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
